Outcome: Taste acuity improvement - Patient reported outcome
Reasons for GRADE if not High:
Risk of bias: unclear randomisation and blinding and high risk of bias due to attrition in Sakai 2002. Downgraded by 1 level.
Serious Imprecision: The CI of the effect estimate indicates no difference as well as appreciable benefit with zinc. Downgraded by 1 level.
Publication bias: Data from Jprn‐C 2013 (awaiting classification) with 150 participants, is unavailable as the authors refused to share data prior to publication.

Outcome: Taste acuity improvement - Objective outcome - Continuous - Overall taste improvement
Reasons for GRADE if not High: Publication bias: Data from Jprn‐C 2013 (awaiting classification) with 150 participants, is unavailable as the authors refused to share data prior to publication.

Outcome: Taste acuity improvement - Objective outcome - Continuous - Taste recognition
Reasons for GRADE if not High:
Serious Imprecision: The CI of the effect estimate indicates no difference as well as appreciable benefit with zinc. Downgraded by 1 level.
Incomplete data due to attrition bias and other bias, such as inclusion of one 3‐year old child, possibility of carry‐over effect.
Inconsistency in outcome assessment: smile or grimace were considered as outcome for 6 month‐old, 3‐ and 5‐year old children.

Outcome: Taste acuity improvement - Objective outcome - Dichotomous - Idiopathic and zinc deficient taste disorders
Reasons for GRADE if not High:
Risk of bias: unclear randomisation and blinding and high risk of bias due to attrition in Sakai 2002. Downgraded by 1 level.
Publication bias: Data from Jprn‐C 2013 (awaiting classification) with 150 participants, is unavailable as the authors refused to share data prior to publication.

Single‐blinded study.
The CI of the effect estimate indicates no difference as well as appreciable benefit with acupuncture. Downgraded by 1 level.
